verses.kjv: For, behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water.
verses.ct: Pay attention — the Lord, the LORD of Armies, is about to strip away from Jerusalem and Judah every source of support and supply, every bit of food and every drop of water.

verses.kjv: The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient,
verses.ct: He will remove the warrior and the soldier, the judge and the prophet, the advisor and the elder,

verses.kjv: The captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.
verses.ct: the military commander, the dignitary, the counselor, the skilled craftsman, and the persuasive speaker.

verses.kjv: And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.
verses.ct: "I will put inexperienced youth in charge as their leaders, and children will govern them."

verses.kjv: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbour: the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honourable.
verses.ct: The people will turn on each other — everyone oppressing their neighbor. The young will disrespect the old, and the worthless will insult the honorable.

verses.kjv: When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand:
verses.ct: A man will grab his own brother in his father's house and say, "You still have a coat on your back — you be our leader! Take charge of this disaster!"

verses.kjv: In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: make me not a ruler of the people.
verses.ct: But on that day, the brother will protest and say, "I can't fix this! I don't even have food or clothing in my own house. Don't make me the leader of these people."

verses.kjv: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen: because their tongue and their doings are against the LORD, to provoke the eyes of his glory.
verses.ct: Jerusalem has collapsed and Judah has fallen, because everything they say and do defies the LORD, provoking his glorious presence.

verses.kjv: The shew of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.
verses.ct: The expressions on their faces testify against them. They flaunt their sin openly like Sodom and don't even try to conceal it. How terrible for them! They have brought disaster on themselves.

verses.kjv: Say ye to the righteous, that it shall be well with him: for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
verses.ct: Tell those who do right that things will go well for them, because they will enjoy the results of their actions.

verses.kjv: Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him: for the reward of his hands shall be given him.
verses.ct: But how terrible for the wicked! Things will go badly for them, because they will receive exactly what their actions deserve.

verses.kjv: As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they which lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.
verses.ct: My people are oppressed by children, and women dominate them. My people, your leaders are misleading you and sending you down the wrong path.

verses.kjv: The LORD standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge the people.
verses.ct: The LORD rises to present his case; he stands to bring judgment against the nations.

verses.kjv: The LORD will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses.
verses.ct: The LORD brings charges against the elders and rulers of his people: "You are the ones who have devoured the vineyard. The goods stolen from the poor fill your houses.

verses.kjv: What mean ye that ye beat my people to pieces, and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord GOD of hosts.
verses.ct: What gives you the right to crush my people and grind the poor into the dust?" declares the Lord GOD of Armies.

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD saith, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet:
verses.ct: The LORD also says, "The women of Zion are arrogant. They strut around with their noses in the air, flirting with their eyes, taking dainty little steps, and jingling the anklets on their feet."

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the LORD will discover their secret parts.
verses.ct: So the Lord will strike the heads of Zion's women with sores, and the LORD will expose their nakedness.

verses.kjv: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments about their feet, and their cauls, and their round tires like the moon,
verses.ct: On that day the Lord will strip away all their finery — their jingling anklets, their headbands, and their crescent-shaped necklaces,

verses.kjv: The chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,
verses.ct: their dangling earrings, their bracelets, and their veils,

verses.kjv: The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the earrings,
verses.ct: their headdresses, their ankle chains, their sashes, their perfume bottles, and their charms,

verses.kjv: The rings, and nose jewels,
verses.ct: their rings and their nose jewelry,

verses.kjv: The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,
verses.ct: their fine robes, their cloaks, their shawls, and their purses,

verses.kjv: The glasses, and the fine linen, and the hoods, and the vails.
verses.ct: their mirrors, their linen garments, their turbans, and their long veils.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent; and instead of well set hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth; and burning instead of beauty.
verses.ct: Instead of perfume, there will be a stench. Instead of a sash, a rope. Instead of styled hair, a shaved head. Instead of fine clothing, rough sackcloth. Instead of beauty, branding marks.

verses.kjv: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.
verses.ct: Your men will die in battle, and your warriors will fall in war.

verses.kjv: And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she being desolate shall sit upon the ground.
verses.ct: The gates of Zion will weep and mourn, and the city will sit empty and desolate on the ground.
